intro: Ageratina infiernillensis, commonly known as the Mexican blueweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and has narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually blue or purple, arranged in dense clusters, and bloom during the summer months. Ageratina infiernillensis is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
